title:
Collision Energy Dependence of Particle Ratios and Freeze-out Parameters
  in Ultra Relativistic Nucleus Nucleus Collisions
authors:
Iqbal Mohi Ud Din (1), Sameer Ahmad Mir (1), Nasir Ahmad Rather (1),
  Saeed Uddin (1), Rameez Ahmad Parra (2) ((1) Jamia Millia Islamia (2)
  University of Kashmir)
abstract:
This work investigates how the theoretically calculated particle ratios and
freeze-out parameters for a multi-component hot and dense non-ideal hadron
resonance gas system, formed during the pre freeze-out stage in
ultra-relativistic nucleus-nucleus collisions, are affected by van der Waals
type interactions, incorporating both repulsive and attractive interactions
among hadrons. The baryons (antibaryons) are treated as hard incompressible
objects. Using this theoretical approach, we analyze experimental particle
ratios involving like-mass as well as unlike-mass hadrons. We also try to
understand the existence of horn-like structures seen in the ratios of strange
particles to pion as a function of the collision energy. Using information
about the dependence of experimental particle ratios on $\sqrt{s_{NN}}$ over a
wide range of collision energies, we have extracted several model freeze-out
parameters and examined their dependence on $\sqrt{s_{NN}}$ The correlation
between the $\bar{p}/p$ and $K^-/K^+$ ratios is also examined.
